name: Marcus Lyall
biography: A graduate of graphic design at St Martins School of Art, London, Marcus Lyall has worked across a vast range of moving image fields. His multi-screen works have been used as part of stadium concert tours by U2, Oasis and the Rolling Stones, his advertisements for clients including TAC and the Melbourne Film Festival have screened widely, and his installation version of Slow Service recently exhibited as part of the Experimenta House of the Tommorow, 2003. Most recently he has created the community art project Tent Chaos in collaboration with Christopher Seater. He currently works as a director for Melbourne production company, Great Southern Films.
